blocks.content: 1.3 Why Version Control, Hosting, and Security Matter

Web development is not just about writing code. You also need to think about **team collaboration (Version Control)**, **deployment (Hosting)**, and **protection (Security)**. Using the example of an **online bookstore**, you‚Äôll see why these three parts are essential.
Imagine you and three friends are building an online bookstore together:

Without version control = you might overwrite each other‚Äôs code, causing chaos.

blocks.title: Analogy
blocks.content: Version control is like a **time machine** that lets you return to a working version of your website whenever needed. (Section 2.1 has a detailed introduction)
Once your website is built, you need Hosting to put it online so others can access it.

Example:
- Without Hosting: The website only works on your computer.
- With Hosting: Deploy it to Netlify or AWS, and anyone can access your online bookstore via a URL.

items: **Benefits**: Global access, automated deployment, stability and scalability

blocks.title: Analogy
blocks.content: Hosting is like **renting a store space**. Without it, even if you have a finished website, customers can‚Äôt walk in.
Without security measures, your online bookstore could be hacked ‚Äî customer data stolen, or your site taken down.

items: - SQL Injection (stealing data from your database)
- CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery, tricking users into unintended actions)
- DDoS (overloading your site with traffic to shut it down)
- Validate user input (to block malicious code)
- Manage permissions (don‚Äôt give regular users admin access)
- Add firewalls or CDN protection (e.g., Cloudflare to block DDoS)

blocks.title: Analogy
blocks.content: Security is like a **security system** for your store. Without it, anyone could break in.

rows: Code conflicts, hard to fix errors

blocks.title: Quick Summary
blocks.content: To build a professional website: **Version Control** keeps development organized, **Hosting** puts your site online, and **Security** ensures stability and trust. All three are essential.
